messages.content: What is the meaning of "Interesting, thanks for weighing in on it". Explain the term "weighing in"

The phrase "weighing in on it" means to give your opinion or thoughts on a particular topic or issue. So the full sentence "Interesting, thanks for weighing in on it" means "That's an interesting perspective, thank you for sharing your thoughts and opinions on this topic".

The term "weigh in" comes from the literal act of weighing a boxer or fighter before a match to determine their official weight class. Over time, the term "weigh in" became metaphorical to mean providing your opinion or perspective on something. So when someone "weighs in on" an issue, they are sharing their views and input on that topic.

Hope this explanation helps clarify the meaning of "weighing in on it"! Let me know if you have any other questions.
Make five example sentences with this phrase.

Here are 5 example sentences with the phrase "weighing in on it":

1. The comment section was filled with people weighing in on it and sharing their opinions about the controversial news article. 

2. The panel of experts consisted of professionals from various fields, each weighing in on it from their area of expertise.  

3. I appreciate you weighing in on it and providing your perspective, as you have more experience in that industry than I do.

4. After the debate, several political pundits weighed in on it with their analyses of the candidates' performances.

5. The issue has become quite divisive with people on both sides weighing in on it passionately on social media.

Does this help show how the phrase "weighing in on it" can be used in different sentences? Let me know if you have any other questions!
What are simile words for "weighting in"?

Here are some simile words that could be used instead of "weighing in" to convey a similar meaning:

Chiming in - "The students kept chiming in with their thoughts and opinions on the topic."

Putting in their two cents - "Several people put in their two cents and shared their perspectives." 

Throwing in their hat - "Many celebrities threw in their hat and gave their take on the viral video."

Jumping into the fray - "More and more commenters kept jumping into the fray to argue their point of view."

Tossing in their thoughts - "Many readers tossed in their thoughts and reactions in the comments section."

Chipping in - "Several guests at the party chipped in with their anecdotes related to the subject of discussion."

The key similarity between these phrases and "weighing in" is that they all describe the act of contributing your opinion or input to a discussion or debate. The similes give a slightly more casual or colorful way to express the same idea of sharing your views and comments on a topic.
